clinical_study.brief_title: Hemoadsorption for Prevention of Vasodilatory Shock in Cardiac Surgery Patients With Infective Endocarditis
clinical_study.official_title: Revealing Mechanisms and Investigating Efficacy of Hemoadsorption for Prevention of Vasodilatory Shock in Cardiac Surgery Patients With Infective Endocarditis - a Multicentric Randomized Controlled Group Sequential Trial

collaborator.agency: Fraunhofer Institute for Interfacial Engineering and Biotechnology
German Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF)

brief_summary.textblock: Infective endocarditis (IE) is associated with high hospital mortality for various reasons; one of them is circulatory failure in patients who undergo cardiac surgery for IE. One discussed reason underlying circulatory failure during surgery is the release of vasodilatatory mediators and cytokines. This study examines the efficacy and safety of a hemoadsorption filter which is approved for the reduction of the concentration of cytokines in the bloodstream.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigators assume a common standard deviation of 3.8 points and that a 1.4-point lower SOFA score in the Intervention Group is of clinical relevance.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: two-arm randomized-controlled group sequential (Pocock) design for assessing superiority and safety
study_design_info.masking_description: Participant will not be informed about group allocation

primary_outcome.description: The investigators will test if mean SOFA scores are different for the experimental and control group.

secondary_outcome.description: Overall mortality rate until day 30 post-surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in cytokine and cfDNA levels
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours before, during cardiac surgery and 24 hours after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: changes in cytokine and cfDNA levels will be measured at different time points before, during and after surgery in both groups; only for the first 2x25 patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours before surgery until day 9 post-surgery
secondary_outcome.description: single SOFA subscores will be analyzed

secondary_outcome.measure: Days on ventilator, vasopressor and renal replacement therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Total days on ventilator, vasopressor and renal replacement therapy within 30 days post-surgery will be assessed
incidence of stroke within 30 days post-surgery will be assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: length of ICU and in-hospital stay
secondary_outcome.description: total length of ICU and in-hospital stay until day 30 post-surgery

arm_group.description: Use of hemoadsorber for removal of cytokines. Participants undergoing cardiac surgery due to infective endocarditis will be treated using a hemoadsorption device (CytoSorb) within the cardiopulmonary Bypass circuit (=Intervention)
Participants undergoing cardiac surgery due to infective endocarditis will be treated according to Standard of care (no hemoadsorption advice installed in the CPB circuit)

intervention.description: Use of the hemoadsorber during cardiac surgery with CPB. Hemoadsorber is integrated into the CPB circuit according to manufacturer's recommendation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with infective endocarditis (according to DUKE criteria) undergoing cardiac surgery
- informed consent
- age ≥18 years and ≤80 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- EuroScoreII ≤ 3
- current participation in another interventional Trial
- pregnancy
- current immunosuppressive or immunomodulatory therapy
